revised_title: The Oxygen Afterglow: A Study of the Factors Affecting the Yellow Glow in Oxygen
tldr: This article investigates the factors affecting the yellow glow in oxygen, specifically the role of water vapor and nitrogen content. The author finds that a powerful afterglow is obtained when there is a minimum of water vapor in the gas phase and a maximum amount of water vapor adsorbed on the glass surfaces. The study also shows that the presence of nitrogen in oxygen is essential for the afterglow to occur.
